event: Earliest human presence in present-day Honduras
Early agricultural villages develop in valleys and highlands
Maya civilization flourishes in the Copán region
Collapse of Classic Maya centers including Copán
Lenca and other Indigenous groups dominate the interior
Spanish conquest of the region begins
Lenca resistance under Lempira challenges Spanish rule
Honduras remains a sparsely populated colonial frontier
Joins the Federal Republic of Central America
Banana exports dominate the economy and foreign influence grows
Cold War conflicts shape politics and security
